channel.title: [allstar fixing npc anim's]
channel.description:
In allstar, when you attacked a NPC it wouldn't block. Well to fix that add
[code] server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].animUpdateRequired = true;[/code]
under
[code] server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].animNumber = server.npcHandler.GetNPCBlockAnim( server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].npcType);[/code]
This basically updates the animations. thanks for reading
and if youre gonna use this, let me know

item.title: [allstar fixing npc anim's]
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“sertan8, post:5, topic:541556”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=660427.msg4415839#msg4415839 date=1395861456]

Cool snippet help the people who think all star’s are worth time putting into it.

Now fix your signature.

They are worth the time. :palm:

That’s what I said because those clients filled with 20k lines really help the server oh and that process method yessss.
[/quote]

is it a good starting base? no
is it a good base to learn of? yes

and you can always change your process method and or clean up your client.java lol

I’m currently programming on an allstar with working prayers a client class file of 300kb, still much, but pretty nice for an allstar. Also fixed up ranging and meleeing combat. Even if a base is shit, you can make it good.[/quote]
I used to think like that do I don’t blame you. You think you can fix the base but really it’s a waste of time. Download an Hyperion trust me it teaches you good java practice against winterLove bases that have terrible code.

Read full topic

That’s what I said because those clients filled with 20k lines really help the server oh and that process method yessss.[/quote]

is it a good starting base? no
is it a good base to learn of? yes

and you can always change your process method and or clean up your client.java lol

I’m currently programming on an allstar with working prayers a client class file of 300kb, still much, but pretty nice for an allstar. Also fixed up ranging and meleeing combat. Even if a base is shit, you can make it good.

@sertan8 wrote:

In allstar, when you attacked a NPC it wouldn’t block. Well to fix that add

server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].animUpdateRequired = true;

under

server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].animNumber = server.npcHandler.GetNPCBlockAnim( server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].npcType);
